post.desc:
My favorite depiction of Shanghai growing big has to be [**Touhou Seichou**](https://mangadex.org/chapter/bd71759a-0b0d-4498-b800-caebd922a123/1).

It's an interesting observation. Why wouldn't Shanghai supernaturally become something more eventually? Hell, I'm open to the compromise with how Millet Soup does it where she seems sort-of independent. Shanghai is (presumably) Alice's main doll. Surely, she's at least a bit more advanced than the other dolls?

And of course, the [**subsequent shipping**](https://mangadex.org/chapter/ea830392-82f7-4922-88c6-b8ff6f9f28ef/1) with Marisa is, I must say ‚Äì a very radical choice. üóø
